front.title: A Path-aware Scheduling Scheme for Multipath Transport Protocols

abstract.t: The design of scheduling data amongst multiple asynchronous paths impacts the performance of multipath transport protocols. This draft proposes a path-aware scheduling scheme, which adaptively selects the most suitable scheduling scheme according to the path characteristics in a time-variant multipath transport scenario. When the path characteristics are unknown, the redundant mode is employed to achieve at least as good performance as that of the best single path. The condition for choosing the most suitable scheduling mode relies on the measured path characteristics and the application requirements. Especially, the path-aware scheduling scheme is designed in this draft in terms of of the delay difference of multiple paths, compared with a pre-defined delay threshold.
